Friends and family, today we take a moment to pause, reflect, and remember. One year ago, nine innocent lives were lost in the heart of downtown Dayton, sending shockwaves throughout our community.

Remembering those taken from us then and struggling amid this global pandemic can often be overwhelming. We implore you to reach out to your community's resources during these difficult times. You are not alone.

Disaster Distress Helpline: 1-800-985-5990 or text ‚ÄòTalkWithUs‚Äô to 66746.

Mayor Nan Whaley
August 4 at 7:55 AM ¬∑

One year ago, Dayton experienced one of the most horrific days in its history. And we‚Äôve had many, many hard days since.

But despite it all, Dayton continues to shine. Daytonians have wrapped arms around one another, disrupted our daily lives to keep others healthy and safe, and stood shoulder to shoulder against injustice. We are a gritty and resilient city, and we have shown time and again that we can face any challenge that comes our way.

This image is made up of dozens of photos submitted by you, showing how you all have seen Dayton Shine over the last year. You can see the full mosaic at https://www.daytonohio.gov/907/Photo-Mosaic

And if you are struggling today - know that you are not alone. Please reach out to someone you trust to talk about it, or call the Montgomery County Prosecutor's Office Victim/Witness Division - 24 Hour Crisis Hotline at (937) 225-5623.

#DaytonShines

The Five Rivers Health Centers at Dayton Public Schools is open to students, families, staff and the Dayton community. The center is located at Roosevelt Elementary (1923 W. Third Street), and is open for summer appointments. Call (937) 965-8694 to schedule an appointment.

Medical appointments: 7:30-11:30 a.m., Monday-Friday.
Vision appointments: 7:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., MWF
Dental appointments: beginning June 1, Monday afternoons and Wednesday mornings.

Masks are required for everyone entering the building (staff, patients, guests) Telehealth appointments may be available to those who prefer this option. Minors with appointments are allowed ONE parent or support person with them at an in-person appointment. No other guests or family members are allowed in the health center. Registration will happen via phone from the car or home, prior to the actual appointment, and the patient will be directed to the exam room at the visit time. All health center patients must complete a lifetime consent form prior to receiving services. This form is available at the health center.

Governor DeWine announced that all Ohio schools will be closed to students through the end of the school year. Dayton Public Schools will continue to provide online learning and paper packets (from various schools).

Additionally, we are working on a plan for students to return their technology and textbooks when they collect their personal belongings from school. We will follow the Governor's orders for social distancing by scheduling times for families to come in to school. This plan will be shared in mid May so that families can arrange times to bring items back and collect personal items before the end of May.

Registration for next school year is available online. Please contact 937-542-5555 if you need support in registering your child.
